Description: ID combining the species and the botanic garden
Year the phenological observation was conducted.
Initial growth, first appearance of a new shoot aboveground.
Onset of leaf unfolding, the first leaf is unfolded.
Onset of flowering, first flower is fully open.
Peak of flowering, the day of the year with the highest flowering intensity.

Maximum intensity of flowering, the maximum percentage of open flowers in the observed population. The maximum number of flowers opening at the same time in each population is defined as the 100 % standard.
End of flowering, no more flowers are open,stamen and stigma are withered.
Flowering duration, calculated from the number of days between the onset and the end of the flowering stage.
Onset of fruiting, date of first ripe fruits.
End of fruiting, no more ripe fruits are visible.
Onset of senescence, leaves are changing colour,drying out or falling off.
Peak of senescence,  the day of the year with the highest senescence intensity.
Maximum intensity of senescence, the maximum percentage of senescent leaves in the obeserved population.
End of senescence, all leaves have fallen off.
Important notes which are useful when data sets from different years are combined and to explain potential outliers
